section.section: The procedures for practitioner performance evaluation required under paragraph (1)(ii)1 of this subsection shall include a review of care provided to patients at the freestanding ambulatory care facility by members of the medical staff.

The review of care shall:
Be undertaken for cases chosen at random and for cases with unexpected adverse outcomes;
Be based on objective review standards;
Include a review of the appropriateness of the plan of care for the patient, particularly any medical procedures performed on the patient, in relation to the patient's condition; and
Except as provided in paragraph (4) of this subsection, be conducted by at least two members of the medical staff who:
As appropriate, are of the same specialty as the member of the medical staff under review; and
Have been trained in the freestanding ambulatory care facility's policies and procedures regarding practitioner performance evaluation.
A review of the care provided by a member of the medical staff who is a solo practitioner shall be conducted by an external reviewer.
A freestanding ambulatory care facility shall take into account the results of the practitioner performance evaluation process for a member of the medical staff in the reappointment process.

text.section:
If appropriate certification by Medicare is available, obtaining the certification shall be a condition of licensure for:
An ambulatory surgical facility; and
A kidney dialysis center.

Each freestanding ambulatory care facility shall provide assurances satisfactory to the Secretary that the freestanding ambulatory care facility does not discriminate against patients, including discrimination based on ability to pay for nonelective procedures.
The Secretary may delegate to the Kidney Disease Commission the Secretary's authority under § 19-3B-07 of this subtitle to inspect kidney dialysis centers.
